English:
Okay, take out your Digimon Capture. I'll take
your fee from it...
Chinese:
那把你的數碼寶貝捕捉器拿出來，
我幫你把他弄下來……
Korean:
그럼 디지몬 캡처를 꺼내봐.
보내줄 테니까…
German:
Okay, hol dein Digimon-Fang raus. Ich
buche die Gebühr dort ab ...

English: ...Huh? What the--?
Chinese: ……嗯？　怎麼啦？
Korean: ……응? 뭔데?
German: ... Hä? Was zum ...?!

English:
Let the other two go.
Stop this kind of business!
Chinese:
把其他兩隻給放了
不要再做這種買賣了！
Korean:
다른 두 마리도 놔줘
이런 장사는 그만둬!
German:
Lass die anderen zwei gehen.
Solche Geschäfte gehören sich nicht!

English:
Huh? Who d'you think you are, saying that to me?
You got a problem with the way I do things?
Chinese:
什麼？為什麼我要聽你的啊？
你現在是對這裡的做法有意見嗎？
Korean:
뭐어? 왜 그런 소리를 너한테 들어야 하는 건데?
이 쪽의 방식에 대해 꼬투리 잡을 셈이냐? 엉?
German:
Was glaubst du, wer du bist, dass du mir das
sagst? Hast du ein Problem damit, wie ich
meine Geschäfte führe?

English:
Amateur hour. You're letting a little TLC by yours
truly get to your head, kid...
Chinese:
所以才說你們這些門外漢，
稍微對你們好一點就得寸進尺了――
Korean: 생초보가. 좀 친절하게 대해줬더니 기어오르고――
German:
Was für ein Amateur. Lass es dir nicht zu Kopf
steigen, dass ich nett zu dir bin ...

English:
...What the--! You don't even HAVE a Digimon
Capture on you?!
Chinese:
是說……你這傢伙是怎麼回事！
仔細一看才發現，你根本沒有數碼寶貝捕捉器嘛！
Korean:
아니……뭐야 너!
잘 보니 디지몬 캡처를 가지고 있지 않잖아!
German:
Was zum ...! Du hast gar kein 
Digimon-Fang dabei?!

English:
You're just a window shopper? How the heck'm
I supposed to turn a profit like this?!
Chinese:
你是來尋我開心的嗎！
這樣子我一毛錢都賺不到啊…！
Korean:
놀리는 거냐!
이래선 한 푼도 득 될 게 없잖아…!
German:
Du guckst nur, was es zu kaufen gibt?
Wie soll ich denn davon leben?

English:
Um, you're the one that just kept talking...
I never said I had one in the first place.
Chinese:
呃，誰叫你一直自說自話……
我從來都沒說過我有數碼寶貝捕捉器啊。
Korean:
아니 그쪽에서 멋대로 이야기를 진행했을 뿐이고…
가지고 있다고는 한마디도 하지 않았는데
German:
Ähm, du hast einfach weitergeredet ...
Ich habe nie behauptet, eins zu haben.

English: Ain't you just as cool as the other side of the pillow!
Chinese: 看來你很囂張啊，喂！
Korean: 여유작작이네, 이 자식!
German: Du bist ja ganz schön dreist!

English: I bet you were feigning ignorance the whole time!
Chinese: 看起來你很瞧不起我們吧，啊！？
Korean: 꽤나 얕보고 있구만, 아앙!?
German:
Du hast dich bestimmt die ganze Zeit über
nur dumm gestellt!

English:
NOW you gone an' pissed me off! Think I better
teach you a lesson, punk!
Chinese:
氣死我了……！
還不給你點顏色瞧瞧……！？
Korean:
열받았다…!
잠깐 아픈 꼴을 당하게 해줄까…!?
German:
JETZT hast du mich wütend gemacht! Ich sollte
dir eine Lektion erteilen, Freundchen!

English:
You came all this way without any Digimon, buddy.
I'm gonna make you regret that mistake!
Chinese:
沒有數碼寶貝還跑來這種地方――
要怪就怪你自己太不知世事了吧！
Korean:
디지몬도 없이 이런 곳까지 온――
자신의 어리석음을 원망해라!
German:
Du bist ohne Digimon hierhergekommen.
Das wirst du bereuen!

English:
No matter how I look at it, all I see is an honest
kid. Plan on fighting a newbie with Digimon?
Chinese:
……這傢伙怎麼看都只是個普通的小鬼啊，
居然用數碼寶貝跟門外漢吵架？
Korean:
……보아하니 이 녀석, 척 봐도 모범생 꼬마잖냐.
초보자 상대로 디지몬으로 싸우는 거냐?
German:
Egal, wie ich es betrachte, ich sehe nur ein
ehrliches Kind. Willst du mit Digimon gegen
einen Neuling kämpfen?

English: Boy...ain't you the popular one.
Chinese: 這還真是……幼稚啊。
Korean: 그건 아무리봐도……어른스럽지 못하군
German: Mann ... was machst du dich beliebt.

English:
Stay outta this! This punk's been mouthing off
about what I do with my scrap!
Chinese:
不要插嘴！
這傢伙，對報廢品的處理在那裡說三道四的！
Korean:
끼어들지 마!
저 녀석, 폐기품 취급에 트집을 잡아댔다고!
German:
Halt dich da raus! Dieser Vogel will mir
vorschreiben, was ich mit meinem
Müll machen sollen!

English: ...Scrap?
Chinese: ……報廢品？
Korean: ……폐기품?
German: ... Müll?

English: ...Interesting. Let me take care of this.
Chinese:
……挺有趣的，
這裡就交給我來了斷吧。
Korean:
……재미있군.
여기선 내가 막아주도록 하지
German: ... Interessant. Ich werde mich darum kümmern.

English: What?! First you show up out of nowhere, now this?
Chinese:
什麼！？
你這傢伙、突然跑出來在說些什麼啊！？
Korean: 하아!? 너, 느닷없이 나타나서 무슨 소릴 하는거냐!?
German:
Wie bitte?! Erst tauchst du aus dem Nichts auf,
und jetzt das?

English:
Here, a Digimon Capture. Take it. You can't do
anything without it, after all.
Chinese:
拿去，這是「數碼寶貝捕捉器」，
沒有這個的話什麼都無法做。
Korean:
"디지몬 캡처"다. 주지.
그게 없으면 시작할 수도 없으니까
German:
Hier, ein Digimon-Fang. Nimm es. Ohne es
kannst du schließlich nichts machen.

English: ...Time for a hacker-on-hacker fight.
Chinese: ……所謂駭客之間的吵架——
Korean: ……해커끼리의 싸움이라는걸
German: ... Zeit für einen Kampf, Hacker gegen Hacker.

English: What're you getting all flustered for?
Chinese: 幹麼這麼害怕？
Korean: 뭘 겁먹고 있어
German: Was bist du denn so nervös?

English:
When us hackers have a bone to pick, there's only
one way to settle things. A Digimon battle.
Chinese:
我們“駭客”之間有爭議的話，
只有一種解決方法──“用數碼寶貝對戰”
Korean:
우리들 "해커"가 싸울 때
해결하는 방법은 단 하나――"디지몬 배틀"
German:
Wenn wir Hacker ein Hühnchen zu rupfen haben,
lässt sich das nur auf eine Weise klären:
mit einem Digimon-Kampf.

English:
That's what it means to pick a fight here in
Kowloon...the hacker's domain.
Chinese:
在這……駭客的領域「Kowloon」裡，
挑釁別人的後果就是這樣。
Korean:
여기서……해커의 세력권인 이 "쿠롱"에서
누군가에게 싸움을 건다는 것은 그런 것이다
German:
Das bedeutet es, wenn man sich hier in Kowloon,
der Heimat der Hacker, mit jemandem anlegt.

English: If you don't like it, get out.
Chinese: 對這個做法不滿的話，就滾出去吧。
Korean: 이 방식이 불만스럽다면 나가
German: Wenn dir das nicht passt, dann geh.

English:
You got mixed up in this without knowing anything,
right? No one would blame you for running.
I won't let that guy lay a finger on you, either.
Chinese:
反正你一定也是在什麼都不知道的情況下，
被捲進來的吧？即便你逃走我也不會怪你，
我也不會讓他對你出手。
Korean:
어차피 아무것도 모르고 휘말린 거겠지.
도망쳐도 비난하지 않아. 이 녀석에게도 손대지 못하게 하겠다
German:
Du wurdest ahnungslos in die Sache verwickelt,
oder? Lauf einfach weg. Ich lasse nicht zu, dass
der Typ dir was tut.

English: But if you run...you'd better give up on Digimon.
Chinese:
但是如果你要逃走的話……
就必須放棄數碼寶貝。
Korean: 그렇지만 도망친다면……디지몬에 대해서는 포기해라
German:
Aber wenn du wegläufst ... solltest du Digimon
lieber aufgeben.

English: ...So what's it going to be? The decision's yours.
Chinese:
……要怎麼做？
你自己決定。
Korean:
……어떻게 하겠나?
네가 정해라
German:
... Also, wie entscheidest du dich? Es bleibt ganz
dir überlassen.

English: ...You've got guts, kid.
Chinese: ……就一般人來說，你很有膽識啊。
Korean: ……모범생치고는 훌륭한 배짱이군
German: ... Du bist ganz schön mutig.

English: ...I think it wants to fight with you.
Chinese: ……我想和你戰鬥。
Korean: ……너와 함께 싸우고 싶다는군
German:
... Ich glaube, es scheint an deiner Seite kämpfen
zu wollen.

English:
To think programs you've neither scanned nor
converted would take to you... How curious.
Chinese:
居然被沒有檢測和轉換的程式親近……
這世上還真是什麼怪事都有。
Korean:
스캔도 컨버트도 하지 않은 프로그램이 따르다니……
묘한 일도 있는걸
German:
Dass Programme, die du weder gescannt noch
umgewandelt hast, dich mögen ...
Wie seltsam.

English:
Still, this'll save us some time. Now all that's
left to do is...
Chinese:
但是，這樣也省下我不少功夫。
接下來――
Korean:
하지만 이걸로 수고를 덜었다.
남은 건――
German:
Wie dem auch sei, so sparen wir Zeit.
Jetzt müssen wir nur noch ...

English: Hey! Who made you the go-between?!
Chinese: 喂、喂…！？　你不是負責仲裁的嗎！
Korean: 어, 어이…!? 넌 중재역할이 아닌거냐!
German: He! Seit wann bist du denn der Mittelsmann?

English:
It's not fair if one side has a numerical
advantage. Now things are even.
Chinese:
雙方數量不同的話，根本就不公平。
這樣條件就相同了。
Korean:
숫자를 맞추지 않으면 불공평하잖나.
이걸로 조건은 동등하다
German:
Es ist nicht fair, wenn eine Seite zahlenmäßig
im Vorteil ist. Jetzt ist es ausgeglichen.

English: ...Let's do this.
Chinese: ……開始吧。
Korean: ……시작하지
German: ... Legen wir los.
